Name: Shabti of Neferrenpet
Description: This ramesside shabti of Neferrenpet belonged in turn to the Anastasi, RaifÃ©, and de Meester de Ravestein collections. This latter collector of Egyptian antiquities offered the piece to the museum in 1884. This attractive statuette is characterised by a curly hairstyle and a pleated garment with a prominent apron. 'The treasury administrator' holds two objects in his hands, the djed-pillar and the Isis-knot. His feet are finely modelled and he wears sandals. Most of the hieroglyphic texts are inscribed on the back of the statuette.
